cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 miles ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest, forecast to turn north Wednesday night and then north-northeast Thursday, paralleling the Southeast U.S. coast toward the North Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina coast in the vicinity of Wilmington

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC; Storm Surge Watch Savannah River, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet, FL to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL; Storm Surge Warning Lantana, FL to Savannah River, GA; Tropical Storm Warning north of Deerfield Beach, FL to Altamaha Sound, GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida east coast through the Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina coasts, including Wilmington, NC
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (79%) of tropical-storm-force winds, 45% chance of 50-kt winds, and about 15% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at Wilmington as the core passes late Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6+ ft possible along the southeastern North Carolina coast (exact height depends on track and tide).
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 5–10 inches with isolated amounts to 15 inches along coastal North Carolina, producing flash-flood risk around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, beach erosion, and a low but non-zero tornado threat Thursday into Friday.
